From such classics as Musso & Frank and The Brown Derby in the 1920s to the see-and-be-seen crowds at ChasenÃ¢Â€â„¢s, Romanoffs, and CiroÃ¢Â€â„¢s in the mid-20th century to the dawn of California cuisine at Ma Maison and Spago Sunset in the 1970s and Ã¢Â€â„¢80s, L.A.Ã¢Â€â„¢s Legendary Restaurants celebrates the famous locations where Hollywood ate, drank, and played.

Author George Geary leads you into the glamorous restaurants inhabited by the stars through a lively narrative filled with colorful anecdotes and illustrated with vintage photographs, historic menus, and timeless ephemera. Over 100 iconic recipes for entrees, appetizers, desserts, and drinks are included.

The glamour of the golden age of drive-ins, drugstores, nightclubs, and hotels are also honored. What book on L.A. restaurants would be complete without tales of ice cream sundaes at C.C. BrownÃ¢Â€â„¢s, cafeteria-style meals at CliftonÃ¢Â€â„¢s, or a mai tai at Don the Beachcomber?

Most of the locations in L.A.Ã¢Â€â„¢s Legendary Restaurants no longer exist, but thanks to George Geary, the memories are still with us
